**Description**: **COSMO** or **COSMOART**, defaults to **COSMO** if omitted
**NONE** or **SPINUP**, defaults to **NONE** if omitted
Either 'gpu' or 'mc'. Controls on which nodes int2lm and cosmo run. Make sure your executables are compiled for the chosen architecure.
The processing-chain sends encountered errors to this address
On which infrastructure the processing chain is run. Usually 'daint'
Either 'debug' or 'normal'
Which project the simulation belongs to
Path to the root of the chain
Name of the simulation, the same as the directory-name the ``config.py``-file is in
Path to zhe root of the input-direcetory tree
Path to where the results, logs and nameslists are copied to after the simulation is done
Path to where the processing chain copies the input files to and starts the simulation from
Path to the input directory where the emissions-files are found. If there are multiple emissions-datasets, this is a list of paths to the directories of the datasets.
Prefix of the emissions-files. List for multiple datasets. Emission-filenames are assumed to be ``{emis_gridname}YYYYMMDD.nc``
Path to the directory where the meteo-files are found. For a nested run, this is the casename of the mother-run. In that case, ``meteo_prefix`` and ```meteo_inc`` can be omitted
Prefix of the meteo-files. Meteo-filenames are assumed to be ``{meteo_prefix}YYMMDD``
Increment in hours between meteo-files
Path to where the nudging-datasets are found
List of prefixes of nuding-files to copy
Date format of the nudging-files. If the obs-nudging-file is called ``cdfin_temp-20150204000000-20150205000000``, the dateformat is ``-%Y%m%d%H%M%S``
Path to the directory containing the extpar-file for int2lm
The name of the int2lm extpar-file
Path to the int2lm executable
Path to the int2lm namelist-template
Path to the int2lm runjob-template
Requested time for the int2lm slurm-batchjob
Number of nodes for the int2lm slurm-batchjob
Number of tasks per node
Number of processes in the x direction
Number of processes in the y direction
Total number of processes
Path to the cosmo(art) executable
Path to the cosmo namelist-templates, ending in ``cosmo_INPUT_``. The ending, for example ``IO`` or ``ORG``, is added by the cosmo-job
Path to the cosmo runjob-template
Requested time for the cosmo slurm-batchjob
Number of nodes for the cosmo slurm-batchjob
Number of tasks per node
Number of processes in the x direction
Number of processes in the y direction
Number of processes for IO
Total number of processes
Path to the reference output
Path to the output of cosmo. If the :func:`jobs.post_cosmo.main` job is executed, this can be set to ``None`` and the path of the post_cosmo-job will be used

Which files and variables are compared. This is a dict with a tuple of filenames as key. The first key element is the filename of the reference file, the second key element is the filename of the output-file of cosmo (usually ``lffdYYYYMMDDHH.nc`` and the value is a list of variables to compare between these two files)
Number of output levels (starting from ground level) for the ``reduce_output`` job, defaults to ``-1`` if omitted, which means that all levels are kept
Switch to convert the unit of trace gases to ppm or ppb. This leads to a better compression rate. Defaults to ``True`` of omitted.
